titlePart.text: SECTION B PERFORMING OPERATIONS
TRANSPORTING
SHAPING
MECHANICAL METAL-WORKING WITHOUT ESSENTIALLY REMOVING MATERIAL
PUNCHING METAL
titlePart.entryReference: processes for changing of physical properties of metals ,

noteParagraph.text: Combinations of operations covered by different sub-classes of class are dealt with in . Combinations of operations covered by any particular sub-class with operations covered by other classes, e.g. with operations involving removal of material, are also dealt with in , except that if the operations covered by the other classes are subsidiary to the operations properly covered in a single sub-class of the combination is classified in that sub-class.
Processes of a kind covered by this class but applied to non-metallic materials may be classified here if they are applicable to metal and cannot be classified fully in one other class.

titlePart.text: ROLLING OF METAL
titlePart.entryReference: auxiliary operations used in connection with metal-working operations covered in , see
manufacture of particular objects, e.g. screws, wheels, rings, barrels, balls, by rolling
pressure welding by means of a rolling mill

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, the term "rolling" is understood to refer to rolling operations in which plastic deformations occur.
The term "continuous process" as used in this sub-class means one employing a mill train designed to have the workpiece enter one pair of rolls before leaving the preceding pair.

titlePart.text: Metal rolling methods or mills for making semi-finished products of solid or profiled cross-section
